tit.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 安楽寿院（あんらくじゅいん）は、京都市伏見区竹田にある真言宗智山派の寺院。
sen.e: Anrakuju-in Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Chizan school of the Shingon Sect located in Takeda, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Anrakuju-in Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Chizan school of the Shingon Sect located in Takeda, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
Anrakujuin Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Chisan school of the Shingon Sect located in Takeda, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 本尊は阿弥陀如来。
sen.e: The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.

sen.j: 山号はなし。
sen.e: It does not have an honorific mountain prefix.
It does not have an honorific mountain prefix.
It does not have a sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 京都の南に位置した鳥羽離宮の東殿に鳥羽天皇が造営した仏堂を起源とする天皇家ゆかりの寺院である。
sen.e: It is a temple with a connection to the imperial family that is thought to have originated with a Buddha statue hall constructed by Emperor Toba at the East Palace of the Toba Imperial Villa that stands in the south of Kyoto.

It is a temple with a connection to the imperial family that is thought to have originated with a Buddha statue hall constructed by Emperor Toba at the East Palace of the Toba Imperial Villa that stands in the south of Kyoto.

It is a temple with a connection to the imperial family that is thought to have originated with a Buddha statue hall constructed by the Emperor Toba at the East Palace of the Toba Rikyu (Toba Imperial Villa) that stands in the south of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 境内に接して鳥羽天皇と近衛天皇の陵がある。
sen.e: The tombs of Emperor Toba and Emperor Konoe stand adjacent to the temple precinct.
The tombs of Emperor Toba and Emperor Konoe stand adjacent to the temple precinct.
The tombs of the Emperor Toba and the Emperor Konoe stand adjacent to the temple precinct.

tit.e: Anrakuju-in Temple and Toba Imperial Villa
Anrakuju-in Temple and Toba Imperial Villa
tit.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 安楽寿院は京都市南郊の伏見区竹田に位置する。
sen.e: Anrakuju-in Temple is situated in Takeda, Fushimi Ward in the southern outskits of Kyoto.
Anrakuju-in Temple is situated in Takeda, Fushimi Ward in the southern outskits of Kyoto.
Anrakujuin Temple is situated in Takeda, Fushimi-ku Ward in the southern outskirts of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 付近一帯は平安時代末期（11～12世紀）、院政の舞台となった鳥羽離宮の跡地であり、安楽寿院は離宮内に営まれた仏堂の後身である。
sen.e: The entire area is the site of the former Toba Imperial Palace that served as a center of imperial cloistered rule at the end of the Heian period (11th-12th centuries), and Anrakuju-in Temple is the successor of a Buddha hall that was built within the villa.

The entire area is the site of the former Toba Imperial Palace that served as a center of imperial cloistered rule at the end of the Heian period (11th-12th centuries), and Anrakuju-in Temple is the successor of a Buddha hall that was built within the villa.

The entire area is the site of the former Toba Rikyu Villa that served as a center of imperial cloistered rule at the end of the Heian period (11th-12th centuries), and Anrakujuin Temple is the successor of a Buddha hall that was built within the villa.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 鳥羽離宮（鳥羽殿とも言う）は、応徳3年（1086年）、時の白河天皇が退位後の居所として造営を始めたものであった。
sen.e: Toba Imperial Villa (also known as Toba-dono Palace) was constructed in 1086 to serve as a residence for Emperor Shirakawa following his abdication.
Toba Imperial Villa (also known as Toba-dono Palace) was constructed in 1086 to serve as a residence for Emperor Shirakawa following his abdication.
Toba Rikyu (also known as Toba-dono Palace) was constructed in 1086 to serve as a residence for the Emperor Shirakawa following his abdication.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 平安京の南に位置する鳥羽の地は桂川と鴨川の合流点にあたり、交通の要衝であるとともに風光明媚な土地でもあった（当時の鴨川の流路は現在よりもずっと東寄りであり、鳥羽離宮は桂川と鴨川に挟まれた土地に位置していた）。
sen.e: The area of Toba located in the south of the city of Heian-kyo is situated where the Katsura-gawa River and Kamo-gawa River converge and was an important center of transportation as well as being an area of natural beauty (the original route of Kamo-gawa river lied further to the east than it is today, and Toba Imperial Villa was situated on the land between Katsura-gawa River and Kamo-gawa River).

The area of Toba located in the south of the city of Heian-kyo is situated where the Katsura-gawa River and Kamo-gawa River converge and was an important center of transportation as well as being an area of natural beauty (the original route of Kamo-gawa river lied further to the east than it is today, and Toba Imperial Villa was situated on the land between Katsura-gawa River and Kamo-gawa River).

The area of Toba located in the south of the city of Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) is situated where the Katsura-gawa River and the Kamo-gawa River converge and was an important center of transportation as well as being an area of natural beauty (the original route of the Kamo-gawa river lied further to the east than it is today, and Toba Rikyu was situated on the land between the Katsura-gawa River and the Kamo-gawa River).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 現在の近鉄竹田駅 (京都府)、名神高速道路京都南インターチェンジ付近が離宮の跡地で、東西約1.2～1.5km、南北約1kmの範囲に御所、庭園、仏堂などが営まれた。
sen.e: The site of the former Imperial Villa consisted of the area around present-day Kintetsu Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Kyoto-Minami Interchange of the Meishin Expressway, and the grounds measured approximately 1.2-1.5km east to west and 1km north to south and included a palace, gardens and a Buddha hall.

The site of the former Imperial Villa consisted of the area around present-day Kintetsu Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Kyoto-Minami Interchange of the Meishin Expressway, and the grounds measured approximately 1.2-1.5km east to west and 1km north to south and included a palace, gardens and a Buddha hall.

The site of the former Imperial Villa consisted of the area around present-day Kintetsu Takeda Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Kyoto-Minami Interchange of the Meishin Expressway, and the grounds measured approximately 1.2-1.5 km east to west and 1 km north to south and included a palace, gardens and a Buddha hall.

sen.j: 最初に営まれた御所は後に南殿と称され（現在の鳥羽離宮公園がその跡）、その後、北殿、泉殿、馬場殿、東殿、田中殿などが相次いで建設され、白河・鳥羽・後白河の3代の院政の舞台となった。
sen.e: The first palace to be built was later named the South Palace (now the site of Toba Rikyu Park), followed by others including North Palace, Izumi Palace, Baba Palace, West Palace and Tanaka Palace, with the area serving as the hub of cloistered rule exerted by Emperor Shirakawa, Emperor Toba, Emperor Go-Shirakawa.

The first palace to be built was later named the South Palace (now the site of Toba Rikyu Park), followed by others including North Palace, Izumi Palace, Baba Palace, West Palace and Tanaka Palace, with the area serving as the hub of cloistered rule exerted by Emperor Shirakawa, Emperor Toba, Emperor Go-Shirakawa.

The first palace to be built was later named the South Palace (now Toba Rikyu Park), followed by others including North Palace, Izumi Palace, Baba Palace, West Palace and Tanaka Palace, with the area serving as the hub of cloistered rule exerted by the Emperor Shirakawa, the Emperor Toba, the Emperor Goshirakawa.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 鳥羽離宮の各御所には白河上皇および鳥羽上皇によって仏堂が営まれた。
sen.e: Buddha statue halls were constructed at Toba Imperial Palace by Retired Emperor Go-Shirakawa and Retired Emperor Go-Toba.
Buddha statue halls were constructed at Toba Imperial Palace by Retired Emperor Go-Shirakawa and Retired Emperor Go-Toba.
Buddha statue halls were constructed at Toba Rikyu by Retired Emperor Goshirakawa and Retired Emperor Gotoba.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 最初に造営された南殿に付属した仏堂は証金剛院と呼ばれ、以下、北殿には勝光明院、泉殿には成菩提院、東殿には安楽寿院、田中殿には金剛心院が造営された。
sen.e: The Buddha statue hall at South Palace, the first palace to be built, was named Shokongoin, that at Izumi Palace named Shokomyoin, that at East Palace named Anrakujuin, and that at Tanaka Palace named Kongoshinin.

The Buddha statue hall at South Palace, the first palace to be built, was named Shokongoin, that at Izumi Palace named Shokomyoin, that at East Palace named Anrakujuin, and that at Tanaka Palace named Kongoshinin.

The Buddha statue hall at South Palace, the first palace to be built, was named Shokongoin, that at Izumi Palace named Shokomyoin, that at East Palace named Anrakujuin, and that at Tanaka Palace named Kongoshinin.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 鳥羽離宮内の他の御所や仏堂が跡形もなく滅びた中にあって、安楽寿院のみが（建物は近世以降の再建であるが）、21世紀の今日まで法灯を伝えている。
sen.e: As the other palaces and Buddha statue halls of Toba Imperial Villa disappeared without a trace, Anrakujuin alone has survived until today (although the buildings was rebuilt in the early modern period).

As the other palaces and Buddha statue halls of Toba Imperial Villa disappeared without a trace, Anrakujuin alone has survived until today (although the buildings was rebuilt in the early modern period).
As the other palaces and Buddha statue halls of Toba Rikyu disappeared without a trace, Anrakujuin alone has survived until today (although the buildings was rebuilt in the early modern period).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 前述のように、安楽寿院は鳥羽離宮東殿に鳥羽上皇が営んだ仏堂（本尊は阿弥陀三尊）が起源で、創建は保延3年（1137年）のことである（鎌倉時代の史書『百錬抄』による）。
sen.e: As stated above, Anrakuju-in Temple originated as a Buddha hall (principal image was Amida Nyorai) built at the East Palace of Toba Imperial Villa by Retired Emperor Toba and founded in 1137 (according to the Kamakura period history text "Hyakurensho").

As stated above, Anrakuju-in Temple originated as a Buddha hall (principal image was Amida Nyorai) built at the East Palace of Toba Imperial Villa by Retired Emperor Toba and founded in 1137 (according to the Kamakura period history text "Hyakurensho").

As stated above, Anrakujuin Temple originated as a Buddha hall (principal image was Amida Nyorai) built at the East Palace of Toba Rikyu by Retired Emperor Toba and founded in 1137 (according to the Kamakura period history text "Hyakurensho").
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 当時は安楽寿院という寺号はなく、単に御堂と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: It was originally called not Anrakujuin but simply Mi-do hall.
It was originally called not Anrakujuin but simply Mi-do hall.
It was originally called not Anrakujuin but simply Mi-do hall.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 安楽寿院の名称の文献上の初見は康治2年（1143年）である。
sen.e: The first written reference to the name Anrakujuin is in 1143.
The first written reference to the name Anrakujuin is in 1143.
The first written reference to the name Anrakujuin is in 1143.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 阿弥陀堂建立の2年後の保延5年（1139年）、右衛門督藤原家成によって三重塔が建てられた。
sen.e: In 1139, two years after the founding of the Amida-do hall, a three-storey pagoda was built by Emon-no-kami FUJIWARA no Ienari.
In 1139, two years after the founding of the Amida-do hall, a three-storey pagoda was built by Emon-no-kami FUJIWARA no Ienari.
In 1139, two years after the founding of the Amida-do hall, a three-storey pagoda was built by Uemon no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards) FUJIWARA no Ienari.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 後に本御塔（ほんみとう）と呼ばれるこの塔は上皇が寿陵（生前に造る墓）として造らせたものであり、上皇（康治元年・1142年に落飾して法皇となる）が保元元年（1156年）に没した際にはこの本御塔が墓所とされている。
sen.e: This pagoda, that later became known as Hon-mito, was constructed during the lifetime of the retired emperor (tonsured and became a cloistered emperor in 1142) to serve as his tomb following his death that came in 1156.

This pagoda, that later became known as Hon-mito, was constructed during the lifetime of the retired emperor (tonsured and became a cloistered emperor in 1142) to serve as his tomb following his death that came in 1156.

This pagoda, that later became known as Hon-mito, was constructed during the lifetime of the retired emperor (tonsured and became a cloistered emperor in 1142) to serve as his tomb following his death that came in 1156.

sen.j: 現在の安楽寿院の本尊である阿弥陀如来像は、この本御塔の本尊として造られたものと推定されている。
sen.e: It is assumed that the Amida Nyorai statue that currently serves as the principal image of Anrakuju-ji Temple was originally crafted the principal image of Hon-mito pagoda.
It is assumed that the Amida Nyorai statue that currently serves as the principal image of Anrakuju-ji Temple was originally crafted the principal image of Hon-mito pagoda.
It is assumed that the Amida Nyorai statue that currently serves as the principal image of Anrakujuin Temple was originally crafted the principal image of Hon-mito pagoda.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: その後久安4年（1148年）頃には鳥羽法皇の皇后美福門院のために別の三重塔が建てられ、こちらを新御塔と称した。
sen.e: Around 1148, another three-storey pagoda was constructed for Cloistered Emperor Toba's wife Bifukumonin and this became named Shin-mito.
Around 1148, another three-storey pagoda was constructed for Cloistered Emperor Toba's wife Bifukumonin and this became named Shin-mito.
Around 1148, another three-storey pagoda was constructed for Cloistered Emperor Toba's wife Bifukumonin and this became named Shin-mito.

sen.j: なお、美福門院は遺言により高野山に葬られており、新御塔には鳥羽法皇と美福門院との子で夭折した近衛天皇が葬られることになった。
sen.e: According to Bifukumonin's will, she was buried on Mt. Koya and Shin-mito pagoda became the burial place of the Emperor Konoe, the child of Cloistered Emperor Toba and Bifukumonin who passed away at an early age.

According to Bifukumonin's will, she was buried on Mt. Koya and Shin-mito pagoda became the burial place of the Emperor Konoe, the child of Cloistered Emperor Toba and Bifukumonin who passed away at an early age.

According to Bifukumonin's will, she was buried on Mt. Koya and Shin-mito pagoda became the burial place of the Emperor Konoe, the child of Cloistered Emperor Toba and Bifukumonin who passed away at an early age.

sen.j: 安楽寿院には、他に九体阿弥陀堂、不動堂などが建てられていたことが記録から知られる。
sen.e: It is known from records that other buildings including a Nine Amida Statue hall and a Fudo-do hall stood at Anrakujuin.
It is known from records that other buildings including a Nine Amida Statue hall and a Fudo-do hall stood at Anrakujuin.
It is known from records that other buildings including a Nine Amida Statue hall and a Fudo-do hall stood at Anrakujuin.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 九体阿弥陀堂は前述の阿弥陀堂に対して「新御堂」と呼ばれ、久安3年（1147年）、民部卿藤原顕頼によって建てられた。
sen.e: The Nine Amida Statue hall was built by Minbukyo (Public Affairs Minister) FUJIWARA no Kaneyori and named "Shin Mi-do" in order to distinguish it from the previously mentioned Amida-do hall.
The Nine Amida Statue hall was built by Minbukyo (Public Affairs Minister) FUJIWARA no Kaneyori and named "Shin Mi-do" in order to distinguish it from the previously mentioned Amida-do hall.

The Nine Amida Statue hall was built by Minbukyo (Public Affairs Minister) FUJIWARA no Kaneyori and named 'Shin -Mido' (new Mi-do hall) in order to distinguish it from the previously mentioned Amida-do hall.

sen.j: 安置する九体阿弥陀如来像は鳥羽法皇の病気平癒を祈って仏師長円に造らせたものであった（『百錬抄』による）。
sen.e: The nine statues of Amida Nyorai housed within were crafted by the Buddhist statue sculptor Choen in order to pray for the recovery of Cloistered Emperor Toba.
The nine statues of Amida Nyorai housed within were crafted by the Buddhist statue sculptor Choen in order to pray for the recovery of Cloistered Emperor Toba.
The nine statues of Amida Nyorai housed within were crafted by the Buddhist statue sculptor Choen in order to pray for the recovery of Cloistered Emperor Toba (according to "Hyakuren sho").

sen.j: 一方の不動堂は、久寿2年（1155年）藤原忠実によって建てられたもので、仏師康助作の不動明王像を安置していた（平信範の日記『兵範記』による）。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Fudo-do hall was constructed by FUJIWARA no Tadazane in 1155 and housed a statue of Fudo Myoo crafted by Buddhist statue sculptor Kojo (According to TAIRA no Nobunori's diary "Heihanki").

On the other hand, the Fudo-do hall was constructed by FUJIWARA no Tadazane in 1155 and housed a statue of Fudo Myoo crafted by Buddhist statue sculptor Kojo (According to TAIRA no Nobunori's diary "Heihanki").

On the other hand, the Fudo-do hall was constructed by FUJIWARA no Tadazane in 1155 and housed a statue of Fudo Myoo crafted by Buddhist statue sculptor Kojo (According to TAIRA no Nobunori's diary "Heihanki").

sen.j: 現在、安楽寿院の近くにある北向山不動院の本尊不動明王坐像がこの康助作の不動像であると推定されている。
sen.e: It is assumed that the seated statue of Fudo Myoo that serves as the principal image of Kitamukizan Fudo-in Temple near Anrakuju-in Temple is this Fudo Myoo statue that was crafted by Kojo.
It is assumed that the seated statue of Fudo Myoo that serves as the principal image of Kitamukizan Fudo-in Temple near Anrakuju-in Temple is this Fudo Myoo statue that was crafted by Kojo.
It is assumed that the seated statue of Fudo Myoo that serves as the principal image of Fudo-in Temple on Mt. Kitamuki near Anrakujuin Temple is this Fudo Myoo statue that was crafted by Kojo.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 安楽寿院には日本各地の膨大な荘園が寄進され、これらは安楽寿院領（後に娘のあき子内親王に引き継がれて八条院領と称される）として、天皇家（大覚寺統）の経済的基盤となった。
sen.e: Anrakuju-in Temple was donated large manors throughout Japan and these temple estates (later inherited by Imperial Princess Akiko and named the Hachijo-in Estate) became the financial basis of the imperial family (Daikakuji lineage).

Anrakuju-in Temple was donated large manors throughout Japan and these temple estates (later inherited by Imperial Princess Akiko and named the Hachijo-in Estate) became the financial basis of the imperial family (Daikakuji lineage).

Anrakujuin Temple was donated large manors throughout Japan and these temple estates (later inherited by Imperial Princess Akiko, the daughter of Emperor Toba, and named the Hachijoin Estate) became the financial basis of the imperial family (Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama)).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: その後、寺は永仁4年（1296年）と天文17年（1548年）に火災に遭い、慶長元年（1596年）の地震でも被害を受けて、創建当初の仏堂や、鳥羽天皇・近衛天皇の陵であった2基の三重塔（本御塔・新御塔）は失われてしまった。
sen.e: Damage caused by fires in 1296 and 1548, and an earthquake in 1596 led to the loss of the original Buddha statue halls, the tombs of Emperor Toba and Emperor Konoe, and the three-storey pagodas (Hon-mito and Shin-mito).

Damage caused by fires in 1296 and 1548, and an earthquake in 1596 led to the loss of the original Buddha statue halls, the tombs of Emperor Toba and Emperor Konoe, and the three-storey pagodas (Hon-mito and Shin-mito).

Damage caused by fires in 1296 and 1548, and an earthquake in 1596 led to the loss of the original Buddha statue halls, the tombs of the Emperor Toba and the Emperor Konoe, and the three-storey pagodas (Hon-mito and Shin-mito).

sen.j: 本御塔は慶長17年（1612年）に仮堂が建てられた後、幕末の元治元年（1864年）、瓦葺き宝形造屋根の仏堂として再興された。
sen.e: Hon-mito pagoda was first rebuilt as a temporary structure in 1612 before being reconstructed as a tiled-roof hogyo-zukuri style Buddha statue hall in 1864.
Hon-mito pagoda was first rebuilt as a temporary structure in 1612 before being reconstructed as a tiled-roof hogyo-zukuri style Buddha statue hall in 1864.

Hon-mito pagoda was first rebuilt as a temporary structure in 1612 before being reconstructed as a tile-roofing hogyo-zukuri (pyramid style temple architecture with roofing tile) Buddha statue hall in 1864.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: この建物は安楽寿院西側に現存し、鳥羽天皇安楽寿院陵として宮内庁の管理下にある。
sen.e: This building still stands on the western edge of Anrakuju-in Temple and is under the administration of the Imperial Household Agency as the Anrakuju-in Temple tomb of Emperor Toba.
This building still stands on the western edge of Anrakuju-in Temple and is under the administration of the Imperial Household Agency as the Anrakuju-in Temple tomb of Emperor Toba.
This building still stands on the western edge of Anrakujuin Temple and is under the administration of the Imperial Household Agency as the Anrakujuin Temple tomb of the Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 一方の新御塔は豊臣秀頼により慶長11年（1606年）多宝塔形式で再建されたものが寺の南側に現存し、近衛天皇安楽寿院南陵としてやはり宮内庁の管理下にある。
sen.e: In 1606, Shin-mito was rebuilt by Hideyori TOYOTOMI as the two-storey pagoda that still stands at the south of the temple and is also under the administration of the Imperial Household Agency as the Anrakuju-in Temple tomb of Emperor Konoe.

In 1606, Shin-mito was rebuilt by Hideyori TOYOTOMI as the two-storey pagoda that still stands at the south of the temple and is also under the administration of the Imperial Household Agency as the Anrakuju-in Temple tomb of Emperor Konoe.

In 1606, Shin-mito was rebuilt by Hideyori TOYOTOMI as tahoto pagoda style (a two-storied pagoda (composed of a square lower story and a cylindrical upper story)) that still stands at the south of the temple and is also under the administration of the Imperial Household Agency as the Anrakujuin Temple tomb of the Emperor Konoe.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 天皇の陵墓に多宝塔を用いる稀有な例である。
sen.e: They are both rare examples of two-storey pagodas that serve as imperial tombs.
They are both rare examples of two-storey pagodas that serve as imperial tombs.
They are both rare examples of tahoto pagodas that serve as imperial tombs.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 現在の安楽寿院は、6つ存在した子院のうちの前松院が寺籍を継いでいるものである。
sen.e: Of the six sub-temples that once existed, Zensho-in temple that has succeeded the temple registration.
Of the six sub-temples that once existed, Zensho-in temple that has succeeded the temple registration.
Of the six sub-temples that once existed, Zenshoin temple that has succeeded the temple registration.
sen.cmt: 指示書に合わせました。

sen.j: 幕末には安楽寿院が鳥羽・伏見の戦いの本営となった。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, Anrakuju-in Temple served as a headquarters during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
At the end of the Edo period, Anrakuju-in Temple served as a headquarters during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
At the end of the Edo period, Anrakujuin Temple served as a headquarters during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 境内には大師堂、阿弥陀堂、書院・庫裏などが建つがいずれも近世以降のものである。
sen.e: All of the strictures in the precinct including Daishi-do hall, Amida-do hall, the shoin and kuri (reception hall and monks' living quarters) date from after the middle ages.
All of the strictures in the precinct including Daishi-do hall, Amida-do hall, the shoin and kuri (reception hall and monks' living quarters) date from after the middle ages.
All of the structures in the precinct including Daishi-do hall, Amida-do hall, the shoin (reception hall) and kuri (monks' living quarters) date from after the middle ages.

sen.j: 本尊を安置する阿弥陀堂よりも弘法大師（空海）像を安置する大師堂の方が規模が大きい。
sen.e: The Daishi-do housing a statue of Kobo Daishi (Kukai) is larger than the Amida-do hall which enshrines the principal image.
The Daishi-do housing a statue of Kobo Daishi (Kukai) is larger than the Amida-do hall which enshrines the principal image.
The Daishi-do housing a statue of Kobo Daishi (also known as Kukai) is larger than the Amida-do hall which enshrines the principal image.

sen.j: 大師堂 - 慶長元年（1596年）の地震で倒壊した新御塔の材を用いて建てたものという。
sen.e: Daishi-do hall: Constructed using the materials of the Shin-mito pagoda that was destroyed by an earthquake in 1596.
Daishi-do hall: Constructed using the materials of the Shin-mito pagoda that was destroyed by an earthquake in 1596.
Daishi-do hall: Constructed using the materials of the Shin-mito pagoda that was destroyed by an earthquake in 1596.

sen.j: 阿弥陀堂 - 本尊阿弥陀如来坐像を安置する。
sen.e: Amida-do hall: Houses the principal image statue of Amida Nyorai.
Amida-do hall: Houses the principal image statue of Amida Nyorai.
Amida-do hall: Houses the principal image seated statue of Amida Nyorai.

sen.j: 昭和34年（1959年）の建立。
sen.e: Constructed in 1959.
Constructed in 1959.
Constructed in 1959.

sen.j: 書院・庫裏 - 寛政7年（1795年）の建立。
sen.e: Shoin and kuri: Constructed in 1795.
Shoin and kuri: Constructed in 1795.
Shoin and kuri: Constructed in 1795.

sen.j: 五輪塔 - 境内北西の老人ホーム前にあり、弘安10年（1287年）の銘がある。
sen.e: Five-ring pagoda: Stands in front of the nursing home to the north of the precinct and carries an inscription dating it at 1287.
Five-ring pagoda: Stands in front of the nursing home to the north of the precinct and carries an inscription dating it at 1287.
Five-ring pagoda: Stands in front of the nursing home to the northeast of the precinct and carries an inscription dating it at 1287.

sen.j: 木造阿弥陀如来坐像
sen.e: Wooden seated statue of Amida Nyorai
Wooden seated statue of Amida Nyorai
Wooden seated statue of Amida Nyorai

sen.j: 像高87.6cmの寄木造。
sen.e: An 87.6cm tall yosegi-zukuri style statue (constructed from multiple pieces of wood).
An 87.6cm tall yosegi-zukuri style statue (constructed from multiple pieces of wood).
An 87.6cm tall yosegi-zukuri style statue (constructed from multiple pieces of wood).

sen.j: 平安時代末期に皇族・貴族の間でもてはやされた定朝様（じょうちょうよう）の穏やかな作風の仏像である。
sen.e: This Buddha statue exhibits the gentle Jocho style that was popular among the imperial family and nobility at the end of the Heian period.
This Buddha statue exhibits the gentle Jocho style that was popular among the imperial family and nobility at the end of the Heian period.
This Buddha statue exhibits the gentle Jocho style that was popular among the imperial family and nobility at the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 胸の中央に卍を刻むことから卍阿弥陀の称がある。
sen.e: It has been named "Manji Amida" (Swastika Amida" after the swastika carved in the center of the chest
It has been named "Manji Amida" (Swastika Amida" after the swastika carved in the center of the chest
It has been named Manji Amida (Swastika Amida) after the swastika carved in the center of the chest

sen.j: 光背の中心部分と台座の大部分も当初のものである。
sen.e: The majority of the pedestal and the center of the halo are original.
The majority of the pedestal and the center of the halo are original.
The majority of the pedestal and the center of the halo are original.

sen.j: 台座は各所に宝相華文を浮き彫りし、像表面だけでなく胎内にも金箔を押す入念な作である。
sen.e: This highly elaborate piece features Hosogemon-pattern embossed carving on the pedestal and gold leaf that covers not only the exterior surface but also the interior cavity.
This highly elaborate piece features Hosogemon-pattern embossed carving on the pedestal and gold leaf that covers not only the exterior surface but also the interior cavity.
This highly elaborate piece features Hosogemon (arabesque flower pattern) embossed carving on the pedestal and gold leaf that covers not only the exterior surface but also the interior cavity.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 台座内に天文23年（1554年）の修理銘があり、そこに「西御塔本尊」とあることなどから、保延5年（1139年）に建てられた三重塔（本御塔）の本尊として造られたものと推定されている。
sen.e: An inscription within the pedestal dating repairs at 1554 has led to the estimation that the statue was crafted to serve as the three-storey pagoda (Hon-mito) erected in 1139.
An inscription within the pedestal dating repairs at 1554 has led to the estimation that the statue was crafted to serve as the three-storey pagoda (Hon-mito) erected in 1139.
An inscription within the pedestal dating repairs at 1554 has led to the estimation that the statue was crafted to serve as the three-storey pagoda (Hon-mito) erected in 1139.

sen.j: 作者は不明であるが、同じ鳥羽離宮内の勝光明院などの造仏を手がけていた当時の著名な仏師・賢円の作かと推定されている。
sen.e: The sculptor is not known but it is assumed to be the work of the renowned contemporary Buddhist sculptor Kenen who created other sculptures in Toba Imperial Villa's other Buddha halls such as Shokomyoin.

The sculptor is not known but it is assumed to be the work of the renowned contemporary Buddhist sculptor Kenen who created other sculptures in Toba Imperial Villa's other Buddha halls such as Shokomyoin.
The sculptor is not known but it is assumed to be the work of the renowned contemporary Buddhist sculptor Kenen who created other sculptures in Toba Rikyu's other Buddha halls such as Shokomyoin.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 絹本著色普賢菩薩像
sen.e: Color on silk portrait of Fugen Bosatsu
Color on silk portrait of Fugen Bosatsu
Color on silk portrait of Fugen Bosatsu

sen.j: 絹本著色孔雀明王像
sen.e: Color on silk portrait of Kujaku Myoo
Color on silk portrait of Kujaku Myoo
Color on silk portrait of Kujaku Myoo

sen.j: 絹本著色阿弥陀二十五菩薩来迎図
sen.e: Color on silk painting of the coming of Amida and Twenty-five Attendants
Color on silk painting of the coming of Amida and Twenty-five Attendants
Color on silk painting of the coming of Amida and Twenty-five Attendants

sen.j: 五輪塔 弘安10年（1287年）銘
sen.e: Inscribed 1287
Inscribed 1287
Five-ring pagoda: Inscribed 1287.

sen.j: 石造三尊像3点
sen.e: 3 stone Buddha statue triads
3 stone Buddha statue triads
3 stone Buddha statue triads

sen.j: 釈迦三尊、薬師三尊、阿弥陀三尊と呼ばれる3点の石仏で、平安時代末期の作。
sen.e: Three stone Buddha statue triads known as the Shaka Triad, Yakushi triad and Amida triad; created at the end of the Kamakura period.
Three stone Buddha statue triads known as the Shaka Triad, Yakushi triad and Amida triad; created at the end of the Kamakura period.
Three stone Buddha statue triads known as the Shaka Triad, Yakushi triad and Amida triad; created at the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 鳥羽離宮内にあった成菩提院跡から江戸時代に出土したものという。
sen.e: Said to have been excavated from the ruins of Jobodaiin at Toba Imperial Villa during the Edo period.
Said to have been excavated from the ruins of Jobodaiin at Toba Imperial Villa during the Edo period.
Said to have been excavated from the ruins of Jobodaiin at Toba Rikyu during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 石質がもろいため剥落が激しい。
sen.e: The stone is extremely weak and the statues display extensive chipping.
The stone is extremely weak and the statues display extensive chipping.
The stone is extremely weak and the statues display extensive chipping.

sen.j: 釈迦三尊と薬師三尊は大師堂手前の小屋内にあり、もっとも保存状態のよい阿弥陀三尊像は京都国立博物館に寄託されている（博物館の前庭に設置されている）。
sen.e: The Shaka triad and Yakushi triad are housed witin a small structure in front of the Daishi-do hall, whereas the better preserved Amida triad has been deposited at Kyoto National Museum (installed in the museum's front garden).

The Shaka triad and Yakushi triad are housed witin a small structure in front of the Daishi-do hall, whereas the better preserved Amida triad has been deposited at Kyoto National Museum (installed in the museum's front garden).

The Shaka triad and Yakushi triad are housed within a small structure in front of the Daishi-do hall, whereas the best preserved Amida triad has been deposited at Kyoto National Museum (installed in the museum's front garden).

sen.j: 京都市伏見区竹田中内畑町74
sen.e: 74 Takeda Nakauchihata-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City
74 Takeda Nakauchihata-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City
74 Takeda Nakauchihata-cho, Fushimi-ku Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 近鉄京都線・京都市営地下鉄烏丸線竹田駅下車、徒歩数分
sen.e: Several minutes walk from Takeda Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line/Kyoto Municipal Subway.
Several minutes walk from Takeda Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line/Kyoto Municipal Subway.
Several minutes walk from Takeda Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line and Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway.

sen.j: 拝観は事前の許可が必要。
sen.e: It is necessary to obtain permission in advance in order to visit.
It is necessary to obtain permission in advance in order to visit.
